title: Why does the formation of a concentration gradient require an input of energy? - Quora

response.answer_text: It doesn’t require an input of energy in the sense of energy flowing into the system. It requires an expenditure of free energy. The formation of a concentration gradient reduces the system’s entropy, so it will never occur spontaneously unless coupled with a greater increase in entropy in the surroundings. Such an increase in entropy could be arranged by running a highly exothermic reaction, to give one example.

There are two ways to input energy: heat and work. Forming a concentration gradient requires work to be done the fluid containing whatever solute is dissolved in it. You can not create that gradient by applying heat to the fluid.
